revisionDesc.change: General - The commentary section is not working at the moment, so I am not finalizing this. Please wait until a couple of sentences of introduction are written

Vote - AcceptText - Agreed with James' comments and crediting T. Christensen. One could quibble with the readings in the first few damaged lines. The editors think something's lost after ἀρτάβη in ll. 1 & 2 (I don't see their dotted letter in l. 1), but the entries below suggest otherwise. I agree with James' readings of ll. 2-4, though l. 2 is ]τος̣ ἀρτά̣ without the beta.

Vote - AcceptText - In the version displayed in papyri.info lin1 is fine. lin3-5 are also fine (but the lines numbers should be changes to 4-6). lin2 of the papyri.info version offers [.7]τος ἀρτά̣βη [.?], the ed.pr. offered ....... τος ἀρτά̣]βη [ . On the original I suggest for lin2: [ca.9]τος̣ ἀρτά̣β and for lin3 3.- [βη] [ca.7]τος ἀρτά̣; for (the new) lin4 4.- [βη] [.4] [ἀρτ]άβη. I suggest writing two brief sentences in introductory matter acknowledging the fact that T. Christensen had noted the missing line three in his remarks in the APIS record. He did not offer a reading. Add -------- between lin6 and lin7 and renumber the whole text. lin15 (new 16) should read 15. Πεμπᾶς <:<:λυπαραχμας|reg|λυπραχμας:>=T. Christensen (APIS record, autopsy)|ed|λυπαραχμας:>; lin16 (new17) should be encoded <:\λυ/παραχμας=T. Christensen (APIS record, autopsy)|ed|λυπαραχμας:>
Vote - DEFER - From the Michigan APIS site: " L. 3 on the papyrus left out in the edition (TC) [= Thorolf Christensen]; l. 15 papyrus has lyprachmas (TC); l. 16 ly is interlinear addition."
Submit - In the last λυπαραχμας, λυ is supra lineam.
Commit - Proofread against the print edition
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)

div.p: In notes preserved in the APIS record for this papyrus T. Christensen remarked that line 3 of the papyrus had not been transcribed in the edition of P.Corn. 31. It seems to me that what was transcribed as line 2 in the edition is a mixture of lines 2 and 3 on the original. The text below offers a renumbering of the lines to accommodate lines 2 and 3 of the original, for which new readings have been made.

div.ab:
ἀρτάβη ἀρτάβη
τος ἀρτάτος ἀρτάβη
βη τος ἀρτά
βη ἀρτάβη ἀρτάβη
ἀρτάβη
Ὡρίωνος
λόγος σιταρίου. Ὡρίων
Παρίωνος ἀρτάβη
Πεμπώτης ἀρτάβη
Ἀφοῦς ἀρτάβη
Ταύρεις ἀρτάβη
λόγος χόρτου
Ἑρηοῦς λυπαραχμας
Ἀπολλῶς λυπαραχμας
Ἀτῖνος λυπαραχμας
Πεμπᾶς λυπαραχμαςλυπραχμαςλυπαραχμας
Ἀφοῦς λυπαραχμαςλυπαραχμας
